intro: Spilanthes grisea var. micra, commonly known as the small gray spilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its small, grayish-green leaves are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is known for its pungent odor and has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties.
